Articles.Content:
Congratulations on 100 posts!

Mind telling me what the texture of Bragg was based off of?

Tylo, since as far as i can tell it's the only planet you can add atmo to

Quick question how did you get oceans to work?

As you know with a bit of name and orbit editing of the .cfg and system files you can move planets from one system to another. I was able to rename your original Fearless and put it into a system. Very cool!
just remember if you are going to change the size of the planet there are two radius values you need to alter
Thanks, but not changing the sizes.

Preview of new system (WIP)

And yes, that moon orbits that close (I'm calling it Screwball)
Nice! I'm hoping you create more then 4 planets for this system.
Right now figuring out how to make a small gas giant roughly half the size of Jool

Right now figuring out how to make a small gas giant roughly half the size of Jool

AAAHHH that would be great!
I'm been thinking of putting a rover on your new Fearless. I see it has an atmosphere. I think that will be my next mission.
Sorry if this was covered, but have you added in any science by chance?
No, I have not.

Wow! That was pretty tricky, landing on Fearless. I think the combination of the thin low atmosphere plus the planet seemed to be rotating faster then most I've landed on.

Took two tries. The first try I just couldn't get slowed down in time, even with all the parachutes. Glad I did an F5 in orbit!

Well, I did make it. I can post some pictures tomorrow if you like?
Yeah fearless is tricky like that. you have to aim for a low spot in the terrain to brake worth a damn
Pics are always welcome

Pics are always welcome

Well, I figured I would ask, you never know people can be funny. Nice planet!

That might be Brag up there in the pictures.

http://i950.photobucket.com/albums/ad343/Larry_M/KSP2014-03-1015-40-11-48.jpg

Edited March 12, 2014 by Larrt_M
Oh just a tip, the drogue chutes open much higher up. also you can adjust the opening height now
Question. Do both planet packs work together? I just saw this out of the blue and I am beyond intrigued. I must check these out in person.

Question. Do both planet packs work together? I just saw this out of the blue and I am beyond intrigued. I must check these out in person.

yes they do.

yes they do.

Thanks man
Oh yeah! Those planets look great!

Just a note, some of the moons have retrograde orbits. (they go the opposite way of the rest)

Also I've managed to make rocky smaller than gilly, and have a SOI of 80. The trade off is it's Gravity at ASL is very very low (.0001g you can literally step off the surface to reach escape velocity), so you will need to be very patient or actually force the ship against the surface.

Edited March 13, 2014 by medikohl
Did you ever get my PM about a planet between the orbits of Eve and Kerbin?
